history.content:
If you plan on taking CS upper div classes, it's in your best interest to petition as soon as possible, because if I'm not wrong, enrollment priority is given to majors first and there is enough demand that it is very difficult for non majors to enroll in CS upper div classes. So if you've completed all your requirements you should petition.

From what you're saying, I don't really see a reason why you would delay petitioning for the CS major. But I don't know what your circumstances are.

Usually students petition for the major in the last semester that they will be completing the CS requirements, so there are some classes that you find grades for only after the semester ends. This is normal. But if you're concerned about whether you'll meet the GPA cap, that is I guess more of a personal decision for you.

If you plan on taking CS upper div classes, it's in your best interest to petition as soon as possible, because if I'm not wrong, enrollment priority is given to majors first and there is enough demand that it is very difficult for non majors to enroll in CS upper div classes. So if you've completed all your requirements you should petition.

From what you're saying, I don't really see a reason why you would delay petitioning for the CS major. But I don't know what your circumstances.

children.subject: GPA is calculated including the semester in progress, the applications are processed after grades come in. I don't know the exact policy in terms of the GPA as it has changed from when I declared, so a CS adviser would probably have more info for that.
At the end of the semester you would need a 3.4 GPA for early declaration
If 3.4 threshold is not met after this semester, then I shall still have a chance to regular declare next semester with a 3.0 ? Meaning, the application to declare CS major is not a one shot thing ?
Yes you can still do the 3.0 declaration if you finish the last class.

For L&S CS, meeting the 3.4 cutoff, I have applied for early declaration this semester. However, after this semester, when the grades are out, for early declaration to succeed, should the final grade in the 6 out of 7 courses completed so far be >= 3.4 or >= 3.0 ?

Is the GPA including the semester in progress counted, or excluding it ? And that GPA needs to be 3.4 or 3.0 ?

If for any reason, the early declaration is unsuccessful, regular declaration next semester by meeting 3.0 cutoff on all 7 courses should be possible, right ?

history.content: What are the consequences of petitioning the CS major today or the beginning of next semester? I really need to know know my grades for this semester before I petition.
history.subject: Declare Now or Next semester
